paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision permits the use of Environment Variables for all project configuration paths. These paths include paths from in all of the project property pages and in the Solution Explorer node property windows.

EiffelEnvision presets the ISE_EIFFEL environment variable to the install path chosen at install-time. This prevents potential conflicts when have ISE_EIFFEL already defined as a system-wide environment variable, as is the case in some EiffelStudio installations. Any other uses of any variables must have those variable defined a system or user environment variables prior to launching a Visual Studio .NET session.
Environment variables in paths are separated out using the '$' (Dollar) symbol. A variable name must only contain alphanumerical and '_' (Underscore) characters.

There are three possible ways to use environment variables.
Stand-alone usage requires that the variable name ends next to a non-variable character. For instance "$ISE_EIFFEL\library" is valid, "$ISE_EIFFELlibrary" is valid but ISE_EIFFELlibrary will be assumed to be the environment variable.
Encapsulating in parenthesis allows the environment variable to be distinguished between what is a variable name and what is not. Therefore, "$(ISE_EIFFEL)library" is valid and will expand ISE_EIFFEL and not attempt to expand ISE_EIFFELlibrary. Paths containing environment variables in this way may also be used as per the first example in "$(ISE_EIFFEL)\library".
Encapsulated in curly braces (recommended convention) is the same as with parenthesis. "${ISE_EIFFEL}\library" will evaluate the same as "$(ISE_EIFFEL)\library".
Note: EiffelEnvision will evaluate all environment variables, on an as-needed basis, internally and will never expose those expanded paths to the outside world, i.e. the User Interface. This means using the automation interfaces, any paths that use environment variables will return paths as they are written. Clients will have to evaluate those environment variables themselves.

Environment variable enable portability flexibility, as it is more the case than not that absolute and relative paths do not expand correctly when transferring projects to another developers machines. Environment variables are just one of the unique qualities of EiffelEnvision.
